briefTitle: A Short Treatment Study of Aripiprazole in Pediatric Patients With Schizophrenia
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Dose-comparison Study of Three Different Doses of Aripiprazole (2 mg/Day, 6-12 mg/Day, 24-30 mg/Day) Orally Administered Over 6 Weeks in Pediatric Patients (Aged 13-17 Years) With Schizophrenia
summary: The objective of this study is to investigate the efficacy and safety of three different doses of aripiprazole (2 mg/day, 6-12 mg/day, 24-30 mg/day) orally administered over a period of 6 weeks in pediatric patients (aged 13-17 years) with schizophrenia

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline at Final Assessment in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
